trans-unit.source: Azure Mobile Engagement User Interface - Reach How To
trans-unit.target: Azure Mobile Engagement User Interface - Reach How To

trans-unit.source: User Interface Overview for Azure Mobile Engagement
trans-unit.target: User Interface Overview for Azure Mobile Engagement

trans-unit.source: How to get started using and managing pushes to reach out to your end users
trans-unit.target: How to get started using and managing pushes to reach out to your end users

trans-unit.source: Once the SDK is fully integrated into your app, you can get started using the the Reach section of the UI to Push notifications to the users of your app.
trans-unit.target: Once the SDK is fully integrated into your app, you can get started using the the Reach section of the UI to Push notifications to the users of your app.

trans-unit.target: Do Your First Push Notification Campaign

trans-unit.source: Send Personalized Pushes
trans-unit.target: Send Personalized Pushes

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Personalize1</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Personalize1</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Personalization works by replacing a marker by from an app info tag so, you'll have to make sure the user has the proper app-info defined first.
trans-unit.target: Personalization works by replacing a marker by from an app info tag so, you'll have to make sure the user has the proper app-info defined first.

trans-unit.source: In this example the targeted users will have an app info tag named rebate_code defined.
trans-unit.target: In this example the targeted users will have an app info tag named rebate_code defined.

trans-unit.source: As you see above the push notification content includes the marker ${rebate_code} which will indicate that it is to be replaced by the actual content of the app info tag.
trans-unit.target: As you see above the push notification content includes the marker ${rebate_code} which will indicate that it is to be replaced by the actual content of the app info tag.

trans-unit.source: Warning: If the app info tag is not defined for the user, the user will not receive the push.
trans-unit.target: Warning: If the app info tag is not defined for the user, the user will not receive the push.

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Personalize2</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Personalize2</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You can further personalize the text your notification
trans-unit.target: You can further personalize the text your notification

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Personalize3</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Personalize3</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Personalize4</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Personalize4</linkText>

trans-unit.source: The body of an announcement may also be personalized with:
trans-unit.target: The body of an announcement may also be personalized with:

trans-unit.source: Differentiate Your Push Notification (in or out of app)
trans-unit.target: Differentiate Your Push Notification (in or out of app)

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Differentiate1</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Differentiate1</linkText>

trans-unit.source: "Out of App Only" delivery mode
trans-unit.target: "Out of App Only" delivery mode

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Differentiate2</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Differentiate2</linkText>

trans-unit.source: "Out of App Only" delivery mode provides push notification when the application is closed.
trans-unit.target: "Out of App Only" delivery mode provides push notification when the application is closed.

trans-unit.source: This is the standard push notification.
trans-unit.target: This is the standard push notification.

trans-unit.source: When you select "out of app only" ,you must have already provided the certificates from the platform that your application is building on (APNS or GCM).
trans-unit.target: When you select "out of app only" ,you must have already provided the certificates from the platform that your application is building on (APNS or GCM).

trans-unit.source: See also
trans-unit.target: See also

trans-unit.source: <link><linkText>Apple Push Notification Service – Certificates</linkText><title></title></link>, Google Cloud Messaging – Certificate](http://developer.android.com/google/gcm/index.html)
trans-unit.target: <link><linkText>Apple Push Notification Service – Certificates</linkText><title></title></link>, Google Cloud Messaging – Certificate](http://developer.android.com/google/gcm/index.html)

trans-unit.source: "in-App Only" delivery mode
trans-unit.target: "in-App Only" delivery mode

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Differentiate3</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Differentiate3</linkText>

trans-unit.source: "In-App Only" delivery mode provides push notification when the application is running.
trans-unit.target: "In-App Only" delivery mode provides push notification when the application is running.

trans-unit.source: For this notification, you do not need to go through the APNS and GCM system.
trans-unit.target: For this notification, you do not need to go through the APNS and GCM system.

trans-unit.source: You can use the in-app delivery system to reach your end-users.
trans-unit.target: You can use the in-app delivery system to reach your end-users.

trans-unit.source: You can fully customize the notification and decide in which activity (screen) the notification will appear.
trans-unit.target: You can fully customize the notification and decide in which activity (screen) the notification will appear.

trans-unit.source: "Anytime" delivery mode
trans-unit.target: "Anytime" delivery mode

trans-unit.source: You can choose an "Anytime" delivery mode, ensures you to reach your end-user whether the application is running or not.
trans-unit.target: You can choose an "Anytime" delivery mode, ensures you to reach your end-user whether the application is running or not.

trans-unit.source: When you select "Anytime" , you must have already provided the certificates from the platform that your application is building upon (APNS or GCM).
trans-unit.target: When you select "Anytime" , you must have already provided the certificates from the platform that your application is building upon (APNS or GCM).

trans-unit.source: Schedule a Push Campaign
trans-unit.target: Schedule a Push Campaign

trans-unit.source: Plan to Start a campaign
trans-unit.target: Plan to Start a campaign

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Shedule1</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Shedule1</linkText>

trans-unit.source: It is the 21st of March and you have an announcement to make and planed for the 22nd of March at midnight.
trans-unit.target: It is the 21st of March and you have an announcement to make and planed for the 22nd of March at midnight.

trans-unit.source: You don’t have to stay in front of the interface to do a push!
trans-unit.target: You don’t have to stay in front of the interface to do a push!

trans-unit.source: You can plan in advance the exact minute notifications will be sent.
trans-unit.target: You can plan in advance the exact minute notifications will be sent.

trans-unit.source: Plan to end a campaign
trans-unit.target: Plan to end a campaign

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Shedule2</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Shedule2</linkText>

trans-unit.source: You want your campaign to stop on the 25th of March at 3.00 pm but you know you won't be there to do it.
trans-unit.target: You want your campaign to stop on the 25th of March at 3.00 pm but you know you won't be there to do it.

trans-unit.source: You don’t have to stay in front of the interface to push!
trans-unit.target: You don’t have to stay in front of the interface to push!

trans-unit.source: You can plan in advance the exact minute your campaign will stop.
trans-unit.target: You can plan in advance the exact minute your campaign will stop.

trans-unit.source: End a campaign manually
trans-unit.target: End a campaign manually

trans-unit.source: <linkText>Shedule3</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>Shedule3</linkText>

trans-unit.source: By default, the "None" check-boxes are selected.
trans-unit.target: By default, the "None" check-boxes are selected.

trans-unit.source: This means that the campaign will start as soon as you activate it in the reach section and will end when you will stop it on the reach section.
trans-unit.target: This means that the campaign will start as soon as you activate it in the reach section and will end when you will stop it on the reach section.

trans-unit.source: Note: Campaigns created without an end date store the push locally on the device and show it the next time the app is opened even if the campaign is manually ended.
trans-unit.target: Note: Campaigns created without an end date store the push locally on the device and show it the next time the app is opened even if the campaign is manually ended.

trans-unit.source: Enhance a Push Notification with a Text View
trans-unit.target: Enhance a Push Notification with a Text View

trans-unit.source: What is a Text View?
trans-unit.target: What is a Text View?

trans-unit.source: <linkText>TextView1</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>TextView1</linkText>

trans-unit.source: A text view is a pop-up with text content.
trans-unit.target: A text view is a pop-up with text content.

trans-unit.source: This pop-up appears after the end-user has clicked on the push notification.
trans-unit.target: This pop-up appears after the end-user has clicked on the push notification.

trans-unit.source: A text view allows you to present more content to your end-user.
trans-unit.target: A text view allows you to present more content to your end-user.

trans-unit.source: This is also the opportunity to present a call to action such as jumping to a page of your app, redirecting to a Store, opening a web page, sending an e-mail, starting a geo-localized search, etc...
trans-unit.target: This is also the opportunity to present a call to action such as jumping to a page of your app, redirecting to a Store, opening a web page, sending an e-mail, starting a geo-localized search, etc...

trans-unit.source: Example: Text View
trans-unit.target: Example: Text View

trans-unit.source: <linkText>TextView2</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>TextView2</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>TextView3</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>TextView3</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Note: when you push a text view, it always comes with a notification first.
trans-unit.target: Note: when you push a text view, it always comes with a notification first.

trans-unit.source: Define the text (After having selected the text announcement content, the sub-section will appear, allowing you to define the text you want to be displayed.)
trans-unit.target: Define the text (After having selected the text announcement content, the sub-section will appear, allowing you to define the text you want to be displayed.)

trans-unit.source: <linkText>TextView4</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>TextView4</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>TextView5</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>TextView5</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>TextView6</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>TextView6</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>TextView7</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>TextView7</linkText>

trans-unit.source: Enhance a Push Notification with a Web View
trans-unit.target: Enhance a Push Notification with a Web View

trans-unit.source: What is a Web View?
trans-unit.target: What is a Web View?

trans-unit.source: <linkText>WebView1</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>WebView1</linkText>

trans-unit.source: A web view is a pop-up with web content.
trans-unit.target: A web view is a pop-up with web content.

trans-unit.source: This pop-up appears when the end-user has clicked on the push notification.
trans-unit.target: This pop-up appears when the end-user has clicked on the push notification.

trans-unit.source: A web view allows you to have more interaction with the end-user.
trans-unit.target: A web view allows you to have more interaction with the end-user.

trans-unit.source: This is also the opportunity to present a call to action such as redirection to App Store, opening a web page, sending an e-mail, starting a geo-localized search, etc...
trans-unit.target: This is also the opportunity to present a call to action such as redirection to App Store, opening a web page, sending an e-mail, starting a geo-localized search, etc...

trans-unit.source: Example: Web View
trans-unit.target: Example: Web View

trans-unit.source: <linkText>WebView2</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>WebView2</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>WebView3</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>WebView3</linkText>

trans-unit.source: About Announcement types:
trans-unit.target: About Announcement types:

trans-unit.source: Notification only: It is a simple standard notification.
trans-unit.target: Notification only: It is a simple standard notification.

trans-unit.source: Meaning that if a user clicks on it, no additional view will appear, but only the action associated to it will occur.
trans-unit.target: Meaning that if a user clicks on it, no additional view will appear, but only the action associated to it will occur.

trans-unit.source: Text announcement: It is a notification that engages the user to have a look at a text view.
trans-unit.target: Text announcement: It is a notification that engages the user to have a look at a text view.

trans-unit.source: Web announcement: It is a notification that engages the user to have a look at a web view.
trans-unit.target: Web announcement: It is a notification that engages the user to have a look at a web view.

trans-unit.source: Select the "Web announcement" content.
trans-unit.target: Select the "Web announcement" content.

trans-unit.source: Note: When you push a web view, it always comes with a notification first.
trans-unit.target: Note: When you push a web view, it always comes with a notification first.

trans-unit.source: Define the web content (After having selected the web announcement content, the subsection will appear, allowing you to define the web view content you want to be displayed.)
trans-unit.target: Define the web content (After having selected the web announcement content, the subsection will appear, allowing you to define the web view content you want to be displayed.)

trans-unit.source: <linkText>WebView4</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>WebView4</linkText>

trans-unit.source: <linkText>WebView5</linkText>
trans-unit.target: <linkText>WebView5</linkText>
